text: <@U4V5EHQ2G> I currently have it in there, yeah. Sometimes it’s really good, and other times it just kinda sits there looking pretty.
I had forgot it copied walker activations until last night. I have a spare one so I may as well test it
Oh yeah, totally go for it! Not getting hit by Ugin makes it great too, since you can wipe the board and just start copying walker abilities.
If you’re ahead on mana, it’s awesome. If you’re behind or at parity, it kinda hurts.
Riding is a weird card since the effect is permanent.
Is [[Anje Falkerath]] just a straight up combo/reanimator commander? I bought the precon and I'm trying to find win cons(so far I have kiki+zealous and some variations of mike&triske)

attachments.fallback: Anje Falkenrath {1}{B}{R} // Legendary Creature — Vampire // Haste // {T}, Discard a card: Draw a card. // Whenever you discard a card, if it has madness, untap Anje Falkenrath. // 1/3
attachments.text:
Legendary Creature — Vampire
Haste
{T}, Discard a card: Draw a card.
Whenever you discard a card, if it has madness, untap Anje Falkenrath.
_"We all hide a little madness behind our sophistication, do we not?"_
*1/3*
attachments.title: Anje Falkenrath {1}{B}{R}

text: Sure
Yes.
She really is.
I like the interactive nature of the gameplay she enables - you almost always have something to do and react to situations.
The precon when I played it let me do a lot, it just wasn’t enough payoff, but that’s eminently fixable.
You don’t have to race to Worldgorger - just straight reanimator would work too.
how do the madness spells play? I think part of my problem is seeing them as redraws only
I think that's what they are, mostly
It depends on your goal. There aren’t enough good ones to count on that unless you’re racing to a combo.
The new curse and the demon are nice but certainly not amazing.
It’s nice to madness the curse onto a blue player about to draw their deck for LabMan but way too situational.
might try to do midrange reanimator them. I don't want to do pure combo
Now if they cast [[Enter the Infinite]] and you madness the curse in response...

text: Xmas!
I thought I heard DJ (Jumbo Commander) describe Madness as a limited mechanic and that’s probably too accurate.
There are only like 50 madness cards, and most are just not much better than running a basic in commander
Is it even very good in limited?
It was fine in SOI limited since there were some decent enablers, etc.
Okay, that's fair.
Madness just has too much upside as a mechanic for WotC to actually push it.
Which is a real shame.
Indeed...but, and here I agree with <@U3MTJRAQL> with regard to yesterday's conversation, it was an odd choice as one of the 4 mechanic themes for this year's decks.
Given those limitations.
Oh, absolutely.
What's weirder still is that they didn't push it or innovate much with the new cards since this was a commander precon, and our format could handle truly strong madness cards.
Bone Miser, for instance, should have had madness, IMO.
I think that the choice for madness was a bit weird, given that we had many new cycling toys.
Bone Miser being the only new discard payoff was also a thing.
Do you think it would help if they were able to give themselves a larger number of new cards to make?
[[Bone Miser]] is such a house...THAT is one of the stars of the precons.

attachments.text:

Whenever you discard a noncreature, nonland card, draw a card.
*4/4*

text: Yes...that is one of the precon limitations they've always had when deciding mechanics, etc.

It's why they couldn't make a ninja precon for so long - there weren't enough, and they wouldn't have enough slots for new cards in a precon to make it work. They solved that using other supplemental products. etc.
Undoubtedly.

root.text: Do you think it would help if they were able to give themselves a larger number of new cards to make?

text:
They usually make 56-59 new cards per commander set (this year was the outlier.)
Factoring in uncommons and commons, that’s about 14 unique new cards per deck. (For the 4 decks format.)

I like that they’re instant (floorboards with anje)
She's basically a tutor in the command zone who also enables other pay offs.
Kinda. She also helps make land drops and smooths out jank hands
Depends on the build, but if you're trying to maximize her value, then that's the most optimal path.
Anje toes a similar line mechanically as Dredge does for me. I think that’s part of why she’s never interested me.

text: Have we mentioned how well she enables Dredge? :wink:
I think you’re better off just jamming every madness card in than conspiracy. You need a lot of creatures to make it worth it.

That’s super true though.
I’ll clarify too. While dredge is obviously powerful and I use it in my own decks, it mechanically bothers me because for the most part, the text outside of dredge means nothing.
Gotcha...at its heart Dredge is just an alternative casting cost mechanic.
i was thinking using that combo to get value, but thinking about it a 2 cards 6 mana combo that doesn't win is kind of bad.

Yeah. Here’s my modified precon list I’m workin on. <https://archidekt.com/decks/172742#Anje>

Eek out value and grind out a win

text: I'm not sure those effects are enough for the incremental punishment they inflict and giving your opponents resources is always dangerous since I don't think the deck's built to handle that.
Let alone the hate they'll draw.
That's fair. I suppose I'm counting on being pretty unthreatening, maybe more than I should
I do love politics though, so it's right up my alley haha
Punisher effects tend to draw attention.
investing on the discard theme seems better than on the draw
It certainly seems more powerful, but I don't really want to do dedicated discard. Leads to non games and more salt than its worth
At least in my experience
that's true
Also, this deck folds to gy hate, period. Your curve is huge (4.05) and you don't have any mana doublers.
So if you can't reanimate, most likely things are going to get stuck in your hand.

That's a fair criticism. Balancing having giant creatures you want to reanimate with having a reasonable curve is something of a struggle. I probably need to pick which creatures I really want as payoff. And I figure GY hate is just the cost of doing business in reanimator
I'd take the punisher slots and look for some mana doubling as a hedge.
Caged sun is an easy add. Cabal coffers and friends are a bit outside of my budget
Nirkana revenant and ghast seem good
Understood, but [[crypt ghast]] and [[Nirkana Revenant]] should be options

text: Since you aren't running Urborg you don't have to worry about giving all your opponents extra mana, etc.
Good ideas. I’ve never messed much with mono black. Can see how it could be fun
Appreciate the suggestions!
No problem - mono-black is my jam.
Oh...you also need more answers to problems (whether instants, etc. )
The Anje decks I've seen run literally every madness card to basically turn it in to a 50 card deck
It doesn't even care about using madness, it just wants to discard madness cards to draw down further.
Then use some combo from the yard or that it hit. Worldgorger, Mike/Trike, Anger/Rise of the Dark Realms/Living Death, etc.
How incredibly dull
The problem isn't so much the combos or whatever, it's that to get to them takes FOREVER and is really difficult to stop, and even if you remove her it's easy to just recast and try again.
It's the Paradox Engine problem really. It's not so much the power level as it is the time wasted getting to the end of it.
Speaking of spinning your wheels forever and never getting anywhere,  I'm thinking about making my 5c cycling deck into swamps matter with golos and urborg.
Mostly because it allows me to have [[Stern Judge]] sneak up on people.
